intro: Hyptis obtusata, commonly known as velvetleaf hyptis, is a perennial herb native to the Americas. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Hyptis obtusata is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
